snippet: Automakers are flooding the Detroit auto show with new hybrid and plug-in models, but the combination of gas prices below $4 a gallon and higher upfront costs for the cars is not attracting consumers.
abstract: Automakers are flooding the North American International Auto Show in Detroit with new hybrid and plug-in models, but the combination of gas prices below $4 a gallon and higher upfront costs for the cars is not attracting consumers; hybrid sales fell to 2.2 percent of the market in 2011 from 2.4 percent in 2010.
lead_paragraph: Automakers are flooding the Detroit auto show with new hybrid and plug-in models, but the combination of gas prices below $4 a gallon and higher upfront costs for the cars is not attracting consumers.

headline.seo: Wanted or Not: Alternative-Fuel Cars Flood Auto Show
headline.main: Wanted or Not: Alternative-Fuel Cars Flood Auto Show
